Content: [telegram] <ca232> No, I just made a compound interest calculator that subtracted claim fees at each claim, and looked up the maximum claim efficiency for kmd held between 1-10000. I assumed interest will accrue immediately (which isn't true), although I don't have mathematical proof I'm thinking that this inaccuracy will be so small as to make negligible difference, given that you're most likely to integer round the final figure anyway. (re @Regnar: Nice! I'm on mobile rn cant check, did you account for the increase cooldown time per claim?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <ca232> To give some quantification to this, my KMD held is in the low thousands. My calculation gives me a claim frequency of around weekly, which will be an extra approx 0.2 KMD per year (!) But by claiming weekly there's obviously extra fees being paid out, so it's not just the KMD holder who benefits from increasing claim frequency to try and find the optimal frequency.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Agreed that the resulting frequency of claiming will likely be about the same (meaning optimal claim times) and the resulting difference probably won't be substantial to most of us (in single digit thousands or less) though it's a pretty big difference in time accruing rewards lost, between claiming daily and weekly. Daily is I think 0.0365 in fees, and 365 hours of time not gaining rewards, which amounts to about 15 days or 4% of the entire year. As compared to weekly which is 52 hours, or 2ish days, or 0.05% of the year. The fees are the more negligible side of this, the downtime I think will be a bigger effect. I'm not sure what you used to make that chart/formula but I'll see if I can throw something together too. Math :D (re @ca232: No, I just made a compound interest calculator that subtracted claim fees at each claim, and looked up the maximum claim efficiency for kmd held between 1-10000. I assumed interest will accrue immediately (which isn't true), although I don't have mathematical proof I'm thinking that this inaccuracy will be so small as to make negligible difference, given that you're most likely to integer round the final figure anyway.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> I guess a clarifying question is, is the rewards percent 5.1% or is it still 5% but the compounding factor brings it to roughly 5.1%?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Shouldn't post random download links in here.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> So I made a little worksheet running just basic FV and got it to match the atomic explorer calculator as a base.
So factoring in the down time (admittedly I cheated and built this in excel) instead of calculating for 1 year in the FV which is what atomicexplorer did, I divided yearly hours (after subtracting cooldown) by total hours in a year to get a <1 number for FV calculations. 
Subtracted fees for claims, and turns out of monthly, weekly, daily, claiming monthly is the best option. (re @ca232: Thanks. Tbh it was imprecise on my part not to factor this in. But I think even without this, the equation will be almost equal to optimal claim frequency- and honestly who is going to make their claim so accurate as to dd:hh? I came up with a figure, rounded to the nearest day, and at some point on that day I'll claim)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> You could technically do better than monthly, but the claim rate changes after each claim. And the gains over claiming monthly vs the custom rate is pretty small. Like if you had 1MM kmd you would get 3 extra KMD by claiming every 14.76 days vs once a month...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> To put it simply. With 100 KMD, if you claim once a month, you'll get 99.9968% my theoretical max. If you claim once a week, its 99.6130%, if you claim daily though, its only 95.3702% the theoretical max! 
Not to say dont claim daily, because you may have to if you make transactions or receive some, buy more etc and they aren't over 10kmd utxo or dont have nlocktime set then you should claim them to set the rewards etc. But yea looks like monthly is best, weekly is a close second, daily is lagging.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Fuconee> 👍 (re @Regnar: To put it simply. With 100 KMD, if you claim once a month, you'll get 99.9968% my theoretical max. If you claim once a week, its 99.6130%, if you claim daily though, its only 95.3702% the theoretical max! 
Not to say dont claim daily, because you may have to if you make transactions or receive some, buy more etc and they aren't over 10kmd utxo or dont have nlocktime set then you should claim them to set the rewards etc. But yea looks like monthly is best, weekly is a close second, daily is lagging.)
